alert.note: Alert for Camden; Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:00PM EDT until July 03 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CAMDEN...AND NORTHWESTERN CURRITUCK COUNTIES...THE CITY OF CHESAPEAKE AND THE SOUTH CENTRAL CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH... At 259 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles southwest of Chesapeake, or 10 miles north of South Mills, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Great Bridge and Northwest around 330 PM EDT. Fentress around 335 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Mount Pleasant, Hickory, Chesapeake Airport and Sharon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
